body_html:
Overall this looks fine, and since you're the author of the papers listed I presume you are implementing it to your spec, but can you take some time to look at https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#contribution-guidelines-and-standards to make sure this PR matches the style of all other TensorFlow python code? There's a lot that would likely fail our sanity check linter.

You will also want to expose the symbol in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/nn/__init__.py so it will be available as tf.contrib.nn.modrelu.

Overall this looks fine, and since you're the author of the papers listed I presume you are implementing it to your spec, but can you take some time to look at https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#contribution-guidelines-and-standards to make sure this PR matches the style of all other TensorFlow python code?  There's a lot that would likely fail our sanity check linter.
You will also want to expose the symbol in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/nn/__init__.py so it will be available as tf.contrib.nn.modrelu.
body:
Overall this looks fine, and since you're the author of the papers listed I presume you are implementing it to your spec, but can you take some time to look at https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#contribution-guidelines-and-standards to make sure this PR matches the style of all other TensorFlow python code?  There's a lot that would likely fail our sanity check linter.

You will also want to expose the symbol in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/nn/__init__.py so it will be available as tf.contrib.nn.modrelu.
